result.execSummary:
The defendant Jairo J Ramirez Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 1:45pm [mo]
Defendant Jairo J Ramirez Martinez in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to provide DNA sample 
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

[MK] case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Jairo J Ramirez Martinez in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted.
Right to counsel given.  Mr. Ramirez indicates that he has not sought counsel, but now he feels he should have an attorney. 
The Court refers Mr. Ramirez to the PD Office; he is to go there today after the hearing.  
The Court further adjourns the Initial Appearance.  Constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
The Court continues the Bond.
